headline: Just Like Wendy's Chili
description: This Wendy's chili recipe tastes just like the yummy one served at the restaurants. The generous batch simmers up in about an hour and freezes well.

video.name: How to Make Wendy's Chili at Home

name: Just Like Wendy's Chili
recipeIngredient: 1 (10 ounce) can diced tomatoes with green chiles (such as RO*TEL)
2 (1.25 ounce) packages chili seasoning (such as McCormick® Mild Chili Seasoning Mix)
salt and ground black pepper to taste
1 tablespoon white vinegar, or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Press ground beef into the hot oil to form one large patty; let the bottom brown, 8 to 10 minutes.
Stir and break browned beef into crumbles. Continue to cook until no longer pink, about 5 minutes longer.
Stir celery, onion, and bell pepper into beef and cook until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.

Pour in stewed tomatoes, tomato sauce, diced tomatoes with green chiles, and water. Break apart large chunks of stewed tomatoes. Stir in chili seasoning. Stir in kidney and pinto beans. Season with salt and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, and simmer for 1 hour.
Mix vinegar into chili just before serving.

review.reviewBody: I have made this several times. It's the only way I fix chili now. The family loves it. I have read where it's greasy in reviews. I don't use olive oil and I drain hamburger.
I made it for Christmas, and put it in my Crock-Pot. I used two cans of each of the beans. My family LOVED it!!! K.B.
I have made this chili exactly as the recipe calls many many times and have never gone wrong. This chili is AMAZING!!!!!

This was a family favorite. I doubled the recipe and used my biggest pot. Instead of pre-mixed chili seasoning, I used the suggestion of another reviewer and used 1 Tbsp. cumin, 1 1/4 tsp. salt, 1 1/4 Tbsp. chili powder, 1 tsp. oregano, 1 tsp. basil and doubled them. I used heaping amounts of the cumin & chili powder and salt & peppered to taste. I was too afraid to add the vinegar at the end. I thought the tomato products had enough zing to them. Next time I will add a little vinegar and see how we like it. Will be making this again and again.
Love it

I made exactly per the recipe except used red beans in place of kidney beans, personal preference. It was similar to Wendy’s but WAY too spicy for me. I think I would’ve liked it better with about half as much seasoning.
It was good.
I loved it! Made it with ground turkey and it was perfect! Definitely making it again!

I cook the hamburger with the onion celery and green pepper in a fry pan then add the meat mixture with along with the rest of the ingredients and cook it in the crock pot for about 8 hours I dont add water at all I use 1 mild 1 spicy chili mix Add lots of garlic and 2 cans of drained mushrooms and it's absolutely amazing 😋
This was the best chili I have ever made.

Not sure if it tastes like Wendy's but this chili was really good! After browning the beef I drained the grease. I also used Ro*Tel Hot habenerol instead of the green chili. I used petite diced tomatoes instead of stewed tomatoes. Used black beans and pinto beans instead of kidney beans. I did not add the vinegar. Awesome chili. I added a slice of pepper jack cheese on top with some tortilla strips. Yummy!

Excellent!! I made this chili for our New Year's Eve celebration and it was exactly like Wendy's chili. This chili recipe is outstanding! If you love Wendy's chili this recipe is for you. OR simply if you want to impress.... make this chili.

This recipe is excellent and easy to make. Instead of using the McCormick® Mild Chili Seasoning Mix, I used the following: 2 tablespoons chili powder, 2 teaspoons ground cumin, 1 teaspoon garlic salt, 1 teaspoon cayenne pepper, 1 serrano pepper. Was bomb!

Except for draining my ground beef and not adding the optional vinegar, I made this recipe exactly as written. This recipe DID taste just like Wendy’s Chili! It was easy to make too, and smelled so good as it simmered. Delicious chili recipe whether you’re looking to make Wendy’s chili or not. I’ll definitely be saving this to make again!

I have always loved Wendys chili since that was my intro to chilli. Made this recipe and it takes just like Wendy's( to me)! For the person who said it was a greasy mess , sounds like she's not familiar in the kitchen. Every cook knows you have to drain the meat!😅
Tastes just like Wendy's!!
Best chili! Taste better than Wendy's!

I make this chili often.. I no longer buy chili.. I make this and it's just me so a lot goes in the freezer.. When a recipe requires chili I pull one container out and use it.. My grandbabies love it.. So does my neighbors!!
I followed this recipe to the letter and it turned out delicious. This is very much like Wendy’s chili. My family loved it, too. This recipe yields a lot of chili, so leftovers are in abundance.
This is a great recipe, easy to make and the entire family enjoyed it. I did not add the vinegar.
Delious and tastes just like Wendy's!!

I will not tell you that I made this better, but I did change it a bit and it was great. I drained the ground beef fat and replaced it equally with "cooking" olive oil before adding ingredients. I added 1 diced fresh garlic clove and 1 cup of shitake mushrooms. I also used white wine vinegar and added 1/2 cup after the chili was done simmering. Great recipe that "I think you could play with" Although I used the Rotel, I did also add some fresh red pepper flakes as well.
I Put a little extra beans in this recipe and it was perfect. Definitely the way I will make all my chili in the future.
Delicious! Although, we ended up only using 1 1/2 of the 2lbs of beef/veggies initially cooked per the recipe as there was so much. Otherwise, made as the recipe stated.
Awesome!
I liked it the grandsons ate it too it's something good to eat and a cold fall night with butter and bread

I have made this numerous times! This is the only chili my daughter likes! I used the Hot Rotel to give it a bit more of a kick, and since my daughter is weird about onions, I liquify them in the food processor before adding them 😁

We loved this chili! So good! Yay! I shared on Facebook too! I didn’t have the tomato paste or other kind of canned tomatoes the recipe calls for and I used a can of crushed tomatoes and tomato sauce. I didn’t have a package of chili seasoning so I sprinkled in garlic powder, chili powder and cumin powder. Yum!!!
Just fry ground beef like you would normally. I added an extra can of each bean plus a can of black beans to stretch the recipe.

Wendy’s don’t use kidney beans in their chili. They use small red beans. I dislike kidney beans and using them to make a copycat chili will change the texture and the flavor ever so slightly. But if you like them and their texture when you bite into them go for it. Also, use a higher fat content of ground beef, which is usually cheaper and omit the olive oil. Seasoning in this recipe is very good.
Great recipe! My family loved this chili. I will make this again.
I've made this recipe just as written ( minus adding water) and it never fails. It's my GO TO When making Chili and always receives rave reviews. Thank you
If only this included Wendy’s hot chili sauce recipe it would be complete.
It’s excellent. The only thing I added was 1/2 t of cumin.
Loved it!! No real changes used 1.5 lbm meat and half cup more water excellent.

I use 2 pkg McCormick chili seasoning, regular. Also use 2 cans of Rotel w/ habanero. Gives it a good bite! I drain and rinse the beans. I use 90%ground beef. At first I was almost afraid to flatten the ground beef and leave it alone for 8-9 minutes. Do not skip this step. It’s an important part of the recipe. A flat bottomed pot helps, too. This recipe has won our neighborhood’s annual chili cook-off since I started entering it, at least 6 yr in a row. Everyone loves it & always goes back for 2nds. This is the ONLY way to make chili.
Solid recipe! I do drain the grease and rinse the beans. No other changes. Thanks for a great chili recipe!
Hands down the best chili recipe ever. We love our chili when winter blows in up here in the frozen north and this is the only recipe we go to.

This is as close as you can get to Wendy’s chili. I make it exactly as the recipe states and is a huge hit every time. I don’t “tweak” or “substitute” anything. Follow the recipe to the letter and you will end up with Wendy’s chili. And as another reviewer stated, it IS better the next day.
My favorite chili recipe. I make it all the time!

This is a great recipe. I add black beans and and chickpeas to Ito it because my my local Wendy's has has black beans and chickpeas. But it's a great recipe we usually serve hours with baked potatoes and a tossed salad
We’ve been using this recipe for several years and the family likes it. It’s really not like Wendy’s but it has just the right seasonings that’s it a hit and easy for an old guy me to make.
I'd Replace the stewed tomatoes for diced tomatoes with chilies and make it five cans of chili beans. Everything else is great.
I finally found my go to chili recipe. I love this! So good!
Great recipe! I added granulated garlic and about tablespoon of dry brown sugar, a few shakes of cayenne.
This is my go to chili recipe. I make it a few times each winter. It freezes well. I prefer to use three cans of beans and only two cans of stewed tomatoes. It's a crowd pleaser every time.

This chili is so good and so simple to make. I made it exactly like the recipe said to. With 3 generations in my house, I feel like a short order cook because everyone has different taste preferences. To my surprise, every single person in the house LOVED it! And that rarely happens. Thank you for the recipe!!

I loved it. Skipped the celery and added a tsp of lime juice. Yes, I went off recipe. But the bones are good and very close.
Everyone dresses their bowl differently: Cilantro, cheese, onions, etc.

This is definitely in the ball park.
Love this recipe. Lots of beef and not too many beans.

This is a perfectly easy and delicious recipe the whole family can agree on . As prepared not too spicy and for lovers of the heat - they can adjust their own bowl. Go to fall recipe and for my fam of 4 it’s a bonus to have extra to freeze and save for a busy night when I don’t want to cook.

I’m a fan of this chili, but my family is now a bigger fan then myself as they requests it at least once a week! 
This is the closest I’ve made to tasting like Wendy’s. I followed the ingredients exactly and I’m very happy that I did. Adding the 1 Tablespoon of white vinegar took this chili above all others. Great-Great Flavorful Chili.

It’s chili. Personally, I add a can of black beans as well and omit the cup of water and it turns out GREAT. Argue all you want about if beans go in chili or not, it’s still delicious. For an added kick, I do 1 mild and 1 hot chili spice mix. Never added the vinegar but I don’t think it needs it.

Great recipe. Very tasty, will make again. A good way to add some more vegetable without really tasting them. The beans and the meat cover up the taste of the celery. Very similar to our family recipe.
The only change is I added four loves of garlic.
I have made this so many times! Huge hit - like outta the park! I stay true to the recipe! My family loves it!
It was delicious and very easy. The vinegar made such a difference, be sure to add it.

I have made this many times. Everyone loves it. The only change I make is I add an additional 2 cans kidney beans in chili sauce and the tomatoes are the chili ready diced tomatoes. Freezes great. This is the best chili recipe I have tried.
Great flavors, served to a group of chili lovers and they loved it!
This recipe is REALLY good! Chili can go in a lot of different directions but this is just an all around great tomato emphasized chili.
First chili I've even made and was very excited to try it because I LOVE Wendy's chili. It came out good and a little spicy, but not like Wendy's at all.
This is my favorite chili recipe! The whole family loves it.

Decided at the last minute to make chili. Never made it before...husband always does. I love Wendy's chili and I came across this. LOVE IT! I didn't have a green pepper but I had everything else. Thanks for making my first time a home run!!!

Dare I say we found the perfect chili recipe?? We enjoy a bit looser chili consistency and this one is bang on. Taste is phenomenal. We made it earlier in the day and followed the recipe except that we prepped the meat, and veggies in a Dutch oven then put it into the slow cooker and added everything else there. We made it for dinner but have already had a couple small bowls each for lunch! It’s our new favourite and will be going back to this and recommending to everyone.

Great recipe...although we did modify it. Instead of browning the ground beef we boiled it to make it leaner. Also omitted the celery & added a jalapeño, a can of black beans and Frank’s Red Hot Sauce (original) to taste.
This is definitely my go to Chili recipe. It tastes great. Looks and smells good. I follow the recipe. ITS REALLY DELICIOUS TRY IT!

Sorry, I'm not a fan. To me it didn't taste at like Wendy's chili. It has a strange sweetness and the flavor is just off. I followed the recipe exactly but used Kroger brand chili seasoning so maybe that was it. I won't make this again.
my family loved it. even my daughter who normally doesn't like chili.
The McCormick's didn't have enough flavor so I added 2 Tbsp cumin, 1 Tbsp ancho chili powder, 3 Tbsp ACV and 1 minced serrano pepper. It was delicious!
I LOVE THIS RECEIPE and so does my family. I make it spicier by using the hot ROTEL or adding Red pepper flakes to it. I am making it tonight again, I will post pics.
Great Recipe!!
I’m a big fan of Wendy’s chili so decided to give this recipe a try. I loved it! Super easy and was honestly surprised how much it tasted like Wendy’s!!
EXCELLENT RECIPE MY FAMILY AND I LOVED IT!

I followed this recipe exactly except I drained the grease from the 80% ground beef after cooking. While it was tasty, neither me or my husband thought it tasted like Wendy's. I might have rated this higher had the title of the recipe not indicated that it would. Overall I would probably make this again. The only thing I would do differently is to chop up the stewed tomatoes before putting them in the pot. They did not break up easily with just a spoon.
Excellent just one adjustment. The stew tomatoes are to big out of can. Cut up to your liking. Very well done!
I think this is a perfect copycat Wendy’s chili recipe and I always make it according to the directions. It’s perfect every time!
This is a good recipe for a simple chili!
Delicious! I don't care for vinegar so I skipped it and I added 1 cup of sour cream because it's a tradition in our house. Definitely going on my meal rotation.
Boom. This was so good. The family loved it. Usually I just make chili by the McCormack pack directions. Never again, the kids asked me to make it again next week.

Husband liked without any vinegar. When I added 1 tbsp afterwards he said it changed the flavor and made all the flavors clash. Oh well. I think it is really good with or without the vinegar. Made recipe as written.
It was just as expected! Simply delicious!
Absolutely identical! We loved it! If you like Wendy's style chili this is it! We followed the recipe exactly.

I'll have to pick some up at Wendy's and compare them side by side. But it's easy and a keeper. I Love all types of Chilis, just depends what you're in the mood for soupy or thick. This is just fine by me! The kids and wife loved it also. My other Favs Tailgater & Flatlander.
Loved it, so good!!
Love it - BUT - it seems a little sour.
Easy make taste great.and just like it says it is just like wendy's.right into my favorites.will make over again
Was tasty but didn't taste like Wendy's to me
Added a poblano pepper and Italian Sausage for a more hearty meal. Added an extra can of sauce and corn starch for a little thickening agent.
Not a celery fan so tossed that out and doubled the beans. Recipe has a great flavour. The liquid tastes great on its own and can easily be sopped up with some nice cornbread.
I halved the recipe. I added a pinch of cyan, 1/2 tsp of cumin, 1/2 tsp of oregano, 1/2 tsp of cyan, 1 Tbsp of chili powder, extra onions and it came out delicious.

Oh my!! It’s better than Wendy’s, and I love Wendy’s chili!!! I added another lb. of ground angus. I also used the spices that Williams chili mix has in it. I highly recommend everyone try it!! It’s really tasty

Quick and Easy!! Didn’t have trouble finding the ingredients at my local grocery store(Giant Food Store). I added some garlic powder, and chili powder, but I’m sure those spices were already in the package of chili seasoning. For me it’s the VINEGAR THAT MAKES IT TASTE LIKE WENDY’S CHILI. When I initially made it I forgot to put the vinegar in and it just didn’t taste right. It tasted flat..blah. When I reheated the leftovers I added the vinegar. I was like WOW, what a difference!! But that was my opinion. I’m definitely adding this to my regular dinner rotation. And a heads up, if you’re a small household I recommend you cut the recipe back. Unless you wanna eat it for a week straight.
Pretty close. Wayyyyyyyyyy too much celery lol (I looked up “stalk” of celery to double check and it’s apparently a whole bunch so 2 is way too much. I’ll probably double the beans next time too

This is one of those "perfect" recipes. You can find the ingredients anywhere, it requires very little prep time and everything goes in one big pot. You can add a little heat to it but I think it's great as is and it tastes even better the next day.
Really good! Switched the pinto beans with kidney beans and it was perfect! Thank you!!

This is such good chili. As is it tastes just like Wendy’s. What I like about this recipe is that you can use it as a base if you want a little more kick or don’t have the exact same ingredients available. I used fire roasted diced tomatoes once as that’s what I had, black beans instead of pinto, diced red pepper instead of green. Corn bread or baked potato on the side is great! Thank you for sharing!
I was amazed at how well this chili turned out. I followed the recipe as written and it is just like having a bowl from Wendys
My husband LOVES Wendy's chili and he was very happy with the results. I'll be making more to stock the freezer.

Made this last night. Followed the recipe to a T. Wasn't as good as I hoped it would be. And would probably recommend using other tomatoes instead of the stewed ones, since there were big chunks in the chili after cooking. Just ok.
My boyfriend really loved this recipe. He recently requested it be made for him again, thanks for sharing with us. I am putting together a recipe book for him and this will defiantly be in there.
